extDescription.message: Remove tracking parameters from URLs and protect your privacy

inputUrlsDescription.message: With this tool you can paste in URLs and Linkumori Clean URLs Tool will clean the URLs after a click on the clean URLs button. You can paste in multiple URLs at once, but every URL must be on a separate line.

statusOn.message: Extension status:On with Network level protection

preventRedirectOn.message: Prevent Google and Yandex services from redirecting URLs to their servers before the final destination is reached:  Active

preventRedirectOff.message: Prevent Google and Yandex services from redirecting URLs to their servers before the final destination is reached:  Off

preventRedirectInactive.message: Prevent Google and Yandex services from redirecting URLs to their servers before the final destination is reached:  (Extension Inactive)

inputUrlsPlaceholder.message: Enter URLs to clean (one per line)

errorMessages_invalidDomain.message: Please enter a valid domain (e.g. example.com)

urlInputPlaceholder.message: Paste URL here to analyze afher analyzing you can add rules

modifiedRequestsLabel.message: Number of requests where URL parameters were successfully removed

activeRulesLabel.message: Total number of parameters removed by this extension

welcomeDescription.message: Thank you for installing Linkumori, your personal URL privacy and tracking protection tool. Linkumori helps you maintain your online privacy by removing tracking parameters from URLs.

feature1.message: Automatically remove tracking parameters from URLs

feature2.message: Protect your privacy across different websites

getStartedText.message: To get started, click the button below to open the extension settings.

aboutDetailsGithub.message: This version is distributed via GitHub. It may include the latest features and updates directly from the repository.

aboutDetailsChrome.message: This version is distributed via the Chrome Web Store. It is the stable version recommended for most users.

aboutDetailsUnknown.message: The source of this version could not be determined. Please check the extension settings or contact support for more information.

__MSG_extDescription__.message: Remove tracking parameters from URLs and protect your privacy

confirmResetStats.message: Are you sure you want to reset all statistics?

confirmRestoreExceptions.message: Are you sure you want to enable all in build whitelist rules?

noExceptionRulesFound.message: No in build whitelist rules found matching '$1'

noExceptionRulesDefined.message: No in build whitelist rules defined

restoreExceptions.message: Restore Default in bulid whitelist Rules

successMessages_settingsExported.message: All settings have been exported successfully

successMessages_settingsImported.message: All settings have been imported successfully

confirmationMessages_importSettings.message: This will override all your current settings. Are you sure you want to continue?

confirmationMessages_importRules.message: This will override all your current custom rules. Are you sure you want to continue?

reportIssueDescription.message: Found an issue with URL cleaning or have a suggestion? Help us improve Linkumori by submitting a report.

beforeReporting.message: Before reporting, check if your issue has already been reported:

additionalInfoPlaceholder.message: Please provide any additional details or comments about the issue...

consentMessage.message: I understand that clicking "Report on GitHub" will redirect me to GitHub with pre-filled information that I have entered on this page, along with additional data shown in the Configuration Information section. I have reviewed the Configuration Information section, which includes details such as my browser information (browser name and version), extension settings, whitelisted domains, custom rules (domain name and parameter), disabled rule IDs, and the extension name and version. I understand that creating an issue requires a GitHub account, and that once I am redirected to GitHub, I will be governed by GitHub’s privacy policies as outlined in $privacy_link$. By submitting the issue on github, I agree to GitHub’s privacy policies as outlined in $privacy_link$. I acknowledge that after being redirected with this pre-filled information, I retain the choice to either submit or cancel the creation of the issue on the repository hosted at $repo_link$. I further acknowledge that even if I cancel the issue creation, GitHub may still collect data in accordance with their privacy policy, as I will have already accessed their platform.

findExistingConsentMessage.message: I understand that clicking "Find Existing Issues" will redirect me to GitHub with search parameters that include the domain name and issue details I've entered. The URL may be visible in GitHub's search history. By proceeding, I agree to GitHub's privacy policies regarding URL parameters. See $link$.
